pr_title: GEODE-8131: reader thread blocked attempting to issue an alert

timeline.message:
GEODE-8131: reader thread blocked attempting to issue an alert

This PR does not solve the problem of the alert system causing a P2P
message reader to block but instead ensures that the reader thread will
write deserialization information to the log before issuing a fatal
alert.  If the alert level is set to "info" this won't help, but no-one
would set the alert level to that level.

Along the way I removed some duplicate strings.

timeline.bodyText: Instead of repeating this code in three places, comment-and-all, it would be better to have the three sites call a new method e.g. logFatal(…). The method could have a block comment telling about what it's contract is etc.
timeline.author: Bill

timeline.bodyText: why is toString() called explicitly in this case but not in the other two?
timeline.author: Bill

replies.bodyText: Beats me why the toString is there - I didn't add it.  I do want to see the full call stack when triaging a problem like this.  Maybe it has to do with alert listeners wanting one-liners?
replies.author: bschuchardt

timeline.message: removing duplicate code & logging toString of exceptions at fatal-level
